poem:
**Pocket Dreams**

In the land where rain weaves tales,  
phones slip into night's soft palms,  
whispering secrets in alleys,  
by lamplight's dim spell.  
A dance of digits, these stolen hearts  
lost in whispers of forgotten streets,  
two of five vanish in fog,  
leaving hands, holding breath—  
empty echoes of what once rang true.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Two-fifths of mobile phone thefts in Europe happen in UK, shows insurance data Nearly two in every five phones stolen in Europe are taken in the UK, according to data collated an insurance firm. An analysis of claims made to the American insurance company SquareTrade showed that 39% of all phone thefts across the company’s 12 European markets were in Britain. This was despite the UK only making up 10% of the company’s European customers.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
